summary: This document is an email forwarding a news article about the resignation of U.S. Labor Secretary Alex Acosta due to pressure related to his handling of the Jeffrey Epstein case while serving as a U.S. Attorney in Florida. The email includes a link to a CNBC article and was sent from an iPhone.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: He is resigning from his position as U.S. Labor Secretary due to mounting pressure related to his past handling of the Jeffrey Epstein case when he served as a U.S. Attorney in Florida.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The case involving Jeffrey Epstein is cited as the reason for the mounting pressure leading to Alex Acosta's resignation.

connections.description: Acosta, as a former U.S. Attorney, was involved in the legal handling of the Epstein case, which later created political pressure leading to his resignation as Labor Secretary.

events.title: Alex Acosta Resigns as Labor Secretary
events.description: U.S. Labor Secretary Alex Acosta resigns from his position due to mounting pressure related to his past role in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

keyFacts: U.S. Labor Secretary Alex Acosta resigned on July 12, 2019.
The resignation was directly due to mounting pressure related to the Jeffrey Epstein case.
Acosta's past involvement with the Epstein case occurred while he served as a U.S. Attorney in Florida.
The information is conveyed via an email containing a link to a CNBC news article.
